items.title: PM Modi Chairs Roundtable with Indian AI Startups Ahead of India AI Impact Summit 2026
items.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi engaged with 12 leading Indian AI startups selected under the Foundation Model pillar, showcasing innovations in Indian language models, speech and video generation, generative AI for 3D content, advanced analytics, engineering simulations, and healthcare diagnostics. This event precedes the India AI Impact Summit 2026 scheduled for February 15 in New Delhi.
items.raw_content: Twelve AI startups participated showcasing work across areas such as Indian language and multilingual foundation models, speech and video generation, generative AI for 3D content, advanced analytics, engineering simulations, and healthcare diagnostics.

items.title: Saudi Arabia's NEOM Green Hydrogen Project Nears Completion, On Track For 2026 Launch
items.summary: Saudi Arabia's $8.4 billion NEOM green hydrogen project has reached 90% construction completion and remains on schedule for completion in 2026. The facility will be the world's largest utility-scale, commercially-based hydrogen facility powered entirely by renewable energy, using 2.2 GW of electrolyzers powered by nearly 4 GW of solar and wind capacity.
items.raw_content: The project will produce around 600 tonnes of green hydrogen daily, which will be converted into about 1.2 million tonnes of green ammonia annually. First deliveries of green ammonia are expected in early 2027. The project is expected to cut up to 5 million tonnes of CO₂ emissions every year.

items.title: African Startups Raised $3.2B in 2025, 40% More Than in 2024
items.summary: African startups raised $3.2 billion in 2025, representing a 40% year-over-year growth compared to 2024's $2.2 billion. This recovery follows two consecutive years of decline, with equity financing driving the rebound and fintech projected to capture 45-60% of total equity investments in 2026.
items.raw_content: Africa is entering a utility-first VC cycle in 2026, where capital flows target foundational rails: payments, mobility, energy, AI infrastructure, B2B SaaS, and commerce enablers. Cleantech is gaining momentum with projected annual growth rates of 20-30% in 2026.

items.title: Scatec Signs Landmark PPA in Egypt for 1.95 GW Solar and 3.9 GWh BESS Capacity
items.summary: Scatec ASA signed a Power Purchase Agreement with Egypt's Electricity Transmission Company on January 11, 2026, for 1.95 GW solar capacity and 3.9 GWh Battery Energy Storage Systems. This represents the largest solar and BESS installation in Africa, expected to generate approximately 6,000 GWh annually with a 25-year USD-denominated PPA.
items.raw_content: Financial close expected in second half of 2026. This is the largest investment in Scatec's history. Scatec will provide Engineering, Procurement, Construction (EPC), Asset Management (AM), and Operations & Maintenance (O&M).

items.title: IBM Unveils Five Technologies Defining UAE Business Landscape in 2026
items.summary: IBM's Institute for Business Value identified five key trends for UAE organizations in 2026: fast decision-making as competitive advantage, AI integration at organizational core, consumer transparency requirements, AI resilience and sovereignty, and quantum computing through ecosystem collaboration. 98% of UAE executives consider AI resilience and sovereignty mission-critical for 2026 strategy.
items.raw_content: 95% of UAE executives report needing to make faster decisions. 81% globally confident they can adapt to new technologies. 89% want to know when they're interacting with AI. 63% concerned about over-dependence on external compute resources.

items.title: Flutterwave Acquires Mono in All-Share Deal to Integrate Open Banking
items.summary: Flutterwave acquired Mono in an all-share deal in January 2026 to integrate open banking across its vast product and geographic reach, highlighting the consolidation trend in Africa's ecosystem. The continent recorded 63 exits in 2024, up nearly 50% year-over-year, with fintech representing nearly half of M&A transactions by mid-2025.
items.raw_content: Regional incumbents (banks, telecoms, insurers, retailers) are primary acquirers seeking digital transformation. African scale-ups increasingly buying peers. Domestic and intra-African buyers now account for over 50% of exits combined.

items.title: India's Medical Technology Market to Reach ₹4.5 Lakh Crore by 2030
items.summary: India's medical technology and devices market, currently valued at ₹1.1 lakh crore (2025), is projected to reach ₹4.5 lakh crore by 2030, representing high-teens to 20 percent annual growth. Digital health and AI are emerging as connective tissue across the evolving healthcare ecosystem, with e-Sanjeevani crossing over 16 crore cumulative consultations.
items.raw_content: By 2026, India expected to be second-largest HealthTech startup hub in Asia. Digital health market expanding at CAGR of approximately 29.5% from 2024 to 2032. New 5G-enabled models allow remote diagnostics, point-of-care ultrasounds, dermatology imaging, and AI-assisted triage.

items.title: India Crosses 203 GW Renewable Energy Capacity, Adds 40+ GW in 2025
items.summary: India surpassed 203 GW of installed renewable energy capacity by November 2025, adding more than 40 GW of solar and wind capacity in 2025 - the country's highest-ever renewable energy expansion. India's battery energy storage capacity is set to rise nearly ten-fold to around 5 GWh in 2026 from 507 MWh in 2025. India set to establish carbon market by mid-2026.
items.raw_content: Solar module manufacturing industry achieved cumulative capacity of 100 GW. India requires approximately USD 300 billion annually in climate-related investment through 2030. EU's Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism entering execution phase in 2026 will impact Indian exporters in steel, cement, aluminium, and chemicals.

items.title: Nigeria's OPay Claims Over 50 Million Users Across Nigeria, Egypt, Pakistan
items.summary: OPay, a leading fintech company with strong presence in Nigeria, Egypt, and Pakistan, claimed over 50 million users and 1 million merchants in April 2024, with monthly transaction volumes surpassing US$12 billion. Nigeria accounts for 28% of all African fintech companies and captured 36% of fintech funding between 2020 and H1 2024.
items.raw_content: Africa's digital payments market projected to exceed $40 billion by 2026, fuelled by young, mobile-first population and rapid e-commerce adoption. Middle East and Africa Mobile Payments Market projected to register CAGR of 30.1% during 2025-2030.

items.title: Middle East to Invest $100 Billion Annually in Energy, AI by 2026
items.summary: The Middle East is lining up more than $100 billion a year in strategic investment by 2026, spanning oil and gas, renewables, healthcare, digital infrastructure and manufacturing. Technology spending in the MENA region forecast to reach $169 billion in 2026 according to Gartner.
items.raw_content: Regulatory frameworks in both UAE and Saudi Arabia are evolving toward greater clarity in areas such as data governance, AI, and cloud services. Saudi Arabia will open its capital market fully to foreign investors from February 1, 2026.

items.title: Karnataka Unveils India's First Commercial Quantum Computer at IIIT-Dharwad
items.summary: Karnataka installed India's first commercial quantum computer at IIIT-Dharwad in January 2026, developed by QpiAI. The state is establishing a Centre of Excellence in Quantum AI and Computing. QpiAI outlined roadmap to scale from 25 qubits to 1,000-qubit quantum computer within next two to three years. India's largest quantum computer, IBM Quantum System Two with 156-qubit Heron processor, to open at Quantum Valley Tech Park in Amaravati in January 2026.
items.raw_content: India's National Quantum Mission committed over ₹6,003 crore (approximately $740 million) by 2031 to accelerate quantum technologies. Mission objectives include developing intermediate-scale quantum computers with 50-1000 physical qubits in 8 years.

items.title: UAE Makes AI Classes Mandatory from Kindergarten in 2025-2026 Academic Year
items.summary: The United Arab Emirates launched nationwide initiative to make artificial intelligence (AI) mandatory subject for all students from kindergarten through grade 12, starting in 2025-2026 academic year. The goal is to prepare Emirati youth for tech-driven future, equipping them with AI skills from early age as part of broader strategy to cement UAE's status as regional leader in AI and digital innovation.
items.raw_content: Curriculum carefully structured and age-differentiated, spanning seven key learning areas introduced progressively. Teachers receiving extensive training in AI, both as subject of study and as teaching tool. UAE building School of the Future where AI plays central role, introducing advanced curricula in programming and data analysis at early stages.

items.title: Four Semiconductor Plants in India Set to Begin Production in 2026
items.summary: Four semiconductor manufacturing plants in India set to begin commercial production in 2026: Micron, CG Power, Kaynes Technology, and Tata Electronics. Tata Electronics plans to bring its semiconductor facility in Assam to commercial readiness by middle of 2026. Government launched SEMICON India Programme with investment of ₹76,000 crore, extending fiscal support of up to 50% of project cost.
items.raw_content: India's chip market set to reach $63 billion by 2026 and $100-110 billion by 2030. Total approved projects under ISM reaches 10 with cumulative investments of around ₹1.60 lakh crore in 6 states as of August 2025.

items.title: African Development Bank to Mobilize $5 Billion for Women Entrepreneurs by 2026
items.summary: The African Development Bank has committed to mobilize US$5 billion by 2026 for women entrepreneurs under its Affirmative Finance Action for Women in Africa (AFAWA) initiative. African women entrepreneurs face $42 billion financing gap. World Economic Forum projects bridging this gap could boost Africa's growth by $316 billion. McKinsey suggests closing gender gaps in workforce could add US$300-400 billion to Africa's GDP by 2030.
items.raw_content: 24% of African women actively engaged in starting and running businesses, representing highest rate globally. Women enterprises receive less than 7% of total venture funding. None of Top 100 most funded African startups were founded by all-female team or solo woman founder. FemFocus 2026-2030 initiative running for five years with €54.8 million supporting gender equality and economic inclusion.

items.title: India's 5G Network Coverage Reaches 85% Population, 800+ Cities
items.summary: India's Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal stated that by end of 2026, entire country will be functioning solely on 5G. Over 800 cities have some level of 5G coverage as of 2025, with 1 million+ 5G base stations targeted by 2026. 5G services rolled out in all States/Union Territories with availability in 99.9% of districts and population coverage of 85%, supported by over 500,000 5G base transceiver stations.
items.raw_content: Urban 5G coverage expected to reach up to 90% in major cities by 2026. Infrastructure developments expected to support digital growth across manufacturing, agriculture, smart cities, and governance. Smart Cities India Expo 2026 includes 5G & 6G Networks, AI & Machine Learning, Cloud & Edge Computing technologies.

items.title: Ethiopia to Launch Third Earth Observation Satellite by 2026 with China
items.summary: Ethiopia planning to launch third Earth observation satellite by 2026, developed in partnership with China. Upcoming satellite will feature improved imaging technology, allowing for more precise data collection and disaster prediction. African space economy valued at USD 24.95 billion in 2025 and projected to expand to USD 39.52 billion by 2030 at CAGR of 7.97%. African countries plan to develop 105 more satellites between 2023 and 2026.
items.raw_content: Angola, Burkina Faso, Egypt, Zambia, Nigeria, Rwanda, Botswana, and DRC expected to either fully scope out, initiate, or continue work on satellites and ground station infrastructure in 2026. Recent launches include Senegal's Gaindesat-1A, Zimbabwe's ZimSat-2, and Djibouti's Djibouti-1B.

items.title: UAE's Hassyan Desalination Plant to Become World's Most Energy-Efficient in 2026
items.summary: UAE's Hassyan desalination plant, due in 2026, will be world's most energy-efficient, supplying two million people while consuming just 2.9 kWh per cubic metre. At Dubai's Hassyan facility, desalinated water will cost just $0.37 per cubic metre. Middle East desalination market expected to nearly double from USD 8.27 billion in 2023 to USD 15.54 billion by 2030, growing at 10% CAGR.
items.raw_content: Middle East surpassed 52 million cubic meters per day of installed desalination capacity by 2024. More than 60% of recent projects adopted reverse osmosis (RO) due to significant energy and cost advantages. Rise of solar-powered reverse osmosis plants rewriting economics. Middle East produces 40% of world's desalinated water.

items.title: Sri Lanka Allocates $120 Million for Digital Transformation in 2026 Budget
items.summary: Government of Sri Lanka pledged to invest 35.6 billion Sri Lankan rupees (approximately US$120 million) to advance digitization of various sectors across country in its 2026 Budget. Introduction of Sri Lanka Unique Digital Identity (SL-UDI), scheduled for rollout in late 2026, will serve as single, secure digital identifier linking citizens to government services, banking systems, taxation platforms, and welfare programs.
items.raw_content: Beyond 2026, Sri Lanka's focus will shift to strategically positioning country as digital innovation and entrepreneurship hub in Asia-Pacific. Digital transformation can help Pakistan unlock up to $59.7 billion in annual economic value by 2030, equivalent to about 19% of GDP.

items.title: Morocco's Gotion High-Tech Gigafactory Set to Open in June 2026
items.summary: Morocco signed $6.4 billion agreement with Chinese battery manufacturer Gotion High-Tech Co for construction of factory with annual capacity of 100 gigawatts. The Gotion High Tech gigafactory set to open in June 2026, which could make it significant export base for European and African markets. Plant set to produce approximately 50,000 tonnes, with initial output of 25,000 tonnes anticipated by September 2026.
items.raw_content: Middle East and Africa Electric Vehicle Battery Manufacturing Market estimated at USD 56.83 million in 2025 and expected to reach USD 106.62 million by 2030, growing at 13.41% CAGR. Nigeria signed agreement to construct USD 150 million lithium-ion battery manufacturing plant in December 2023.

items.title: India-Middle East-Europe Economic Corridor Gets Renewed Push in 2026
items.summary: IMEC got renewed enthusiasm during Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's first visit to White House after inauguration of President Donald Trump. India-US Joint Statement in February 2025 stated leaders plan to convene partners from corridor within six months to announce new initiatives in 2025. Key deliverables could include communiqué outlining road map for IMEC through 2026 and intent to form coordinating body through G20/G7 processes.
items.raw_content: For India alone, IMEC could generate overall increase of between 5-8% in Indian export valuation, returning $21.85 billion of additional Indian exports annually. Transshipment times could be reduced by about 40% relative to maritime routes, generating approximately $5.4 billion in annual savings on Asia-Europe trade.

items.title: Ghana Legalizes Crypto Trading with Virtual Asset Service Providers Bill 2025
items.summary: Ghana has legalized crypto trading by passing Virtual Asset Service Providers Bill, 2025, ending years of regulatory uncertainty around digital assets in West African nation. Bank of Ghana plans to roll out licensing and supervisory rules in phases during 2026. Sub-Saharan Africa's crypto flows topped $200 billion.
items.raw_content: Ghana and Rwanda signed Africa's first fintech licence-passporting agreement on February 25, 2025, allowing startups licensed in either country to operate in both markets without starting from scratch. South Africa's CARF regulations set to take effect on March 1, 2026, requiring exchanges to validate user tax residency.

items.title: India's EV Charging Infrastructure to Deploy 22,100 Fast Chargers by March 2026
items.summary: India's PM E-DRIVE Scheme includes INR 20 billion (USD 240 million) for public EV charging stations, with plans to support targeted 22,100 EV chargers for electric four-wheeled vehicles through March 2026. Government earmarked ₹2,000 crore to expand public EV charging stations nationwide, funding approximately 72,000 new chargers by FY 2025-26.
items.raw_content: Major charging operators aim to install 20,000 advanced chargers with smart features in 2026. Bolt.Earth's network reached over 100,000 chargers across 1,800 cities, accounting for nearly 63% of India's public charging infrastructure. India EV Charging Market valued USD 348.5 million in 2024, projected to reach USD 1652.2 million by 2030, with CAGR of 27.67%.

items.title: Africa's Climate-Smart Agriculture Targets 25 Million Farmers by 2026
items.summary: World Bank working towards achieving targets in Africa by 2026, including adoption of Climate-Smart Agriculture (CSA) by 25 million farmers. By 2026, estimated that up to 50% of commercial-scale farms will adopt at least one form of climate-smart agriculture. Studies reported adopting CSA technologies can reduce approximately 15% of crop losses due to drought and improve crop productivity by 38%.
items.raw_content: 60%+ of sector growth through 2026 will be driven by digital innovation, value addition, and regionally-integrated policies. Africa Climate Business Plan calls for $16 billion in funding to help African people and countries adapt to climate change.

items.title: Middle East Vertical Farming Market to Reach $802 Million by 2030
items.summary: 7th Global Vertical Farming Show scheduled for September 2-3, 2026, in Dubai. Middle East vertical farming market estimated at USD 403.97 million in 2025 and expected to reach USD 801.99 million by 2030, at CAGR of 14.7%. Indoor farming in UAE projected to grow to USD 358.9M by 2031. Saudi Arabia's Public Investment Fund signed joint venture with AeroFarms to build indoor vertical farms, with first farm expected to have annual production capacity of up to 1.1 million kg of crops.
items.raw_content: UAE relies on imports for more than 86% of food sourced from abroad. Saudi Arabia aims to boost domestic food production by up to 50% and reduce reliance on imports by 30% under Vision 2030. Energy costs account for up to 40% of vertical farming operational expenses.

items.title: Abu Dhabi Allocates Dh13 Billion for AI-Enabled Government by 2027
items.summary: Abu Dhabi aims to become world's first AI-enabled government by 2027, with approximately Dh13 billion ($3.53 billion) being allocated between 2025 and 2027 to foster innovation and drive AI adoption across government departments. Starting January 2026, UAE will adopt National Artificial Intelligence System as advisory member of Cabinet, Ministerial Development Council, and boards of all federal entities and state-owned companies.
items.raw_content: Law No. (3) of 2024, issued in January 2024, formally established Artificial Intelligence and Advanced Technology Council (AIATC) in Abu Dhabi, tasked with regulating and overseeing AI and advanced technology projects, research, infrastructure, and investment within emirate.

items.title: India Develops PathGennie Open-Source Drug Discovery Software
items.summary: India strengthened biomedical research ecosystem with development of PathGennie, indigenous open-source software for drug discovery developed by Ministry of Science and Technology. Focuses on improving accuracy and speed of early-stage drug research through advanced computational methods while reducing dependence on costly proprietary tools. Weight-loss drugs set to drive substantial growth in India's pharmaceutical sector by 2026.
items.raw_content: India's domestic pharmaceutical market expected to reach US$120-130 billion by 2030. Value of country's bioeconomy stood at $137.2 billion in 2022 and estimated to reach $300 billion by 2030. ICMR Network of Phase 1 Clinical Trials designed to create robust infrastructure supporting rigorous demands of early phase clinical trials.

items.title: African Circular Economy Facility Targets €10 Million Additional Funding by 2026
items.summary: By 2026, African Circular Economy Facility (ACEF) aims to secure additional €10 million to fund growth and advance Africa's shift to circularity. Second pillar develops circular businesses through AfriCircular Innovators Programme, which supports micro, small and medium enterprises in Abidjan, Accra, and Kigali through mini-grants and capacity-building. Ecoembes launched Open Call for Waste Management Startups 2026 - international innovation challenge.
items.raw_content: Nearly 250 million metric tons of waste discarded annually in African cities. Waste Innovation Challenge in South Africa empowers 400 participants through training, mentorship, and business development support, with top innovators competing for shared prize pool of R255,000.

items.title: Tanzania Launches Infant Biometric Registration Pilot with UNICEF
items.summary: Tanzania launching infant biometric registration pilot with UNICEF support. Initiative will ensure that every child born in Tanzania receives digital identity before leaving hospital, while streamlining access to public and private services. Tanzania integrating its digital ID and CRVS systems to improve systems' governance. Kenya's Ministry of Investments, Trade and Industry leading initiative to introduce compulsory digital ID to facilitate identity verification in online commercial transactions.
items.raw_content: ID4Africa 2026 AGM will take place in Abidjan, Cote d'Ivoire. Kenya implementing Maisha Namba digital ID system considered foundation of all digital transactions, about third year of implementation.

items.title: 5 African Startups Advance Commerce, Creators, Crops, and Legal Services
items.summary: Five innovative African startups highlighted: Yelen (Côte d'Ivoire e-commerce for SMEs, 3,000+ vendors), Kave Africa (Nigeria creator marketing, 6,000 creators database), Clisense (Rwanda/Nigeria agritech using satellite data), IntaOps (Nigeria healthcare data interoperability, piloting with 6 Lagos hospitals), and ModulawAI (Nigeria legaltech with AI-powered legal research, 1,700+ users, 100+ paying customers since August 2025 launch).
items.raw_content: Yelen provides e-commerce ecosystem for SMEs in Francophone Africa with local mobile money integration across seven West African nations. Clisense preparing for seed round in 2026. IntaOps raising $300,000, plans full monetization in February 2026.

items.title: India's Digital Economy to Reach 20% by 2026-27: Minister Scindia
items.summary: India's minister Jyotiraditya Scindia stated India's digital economy will reach 20 percent by 2026-27, urging SATRC member nations—including Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Bhutan, India, Iran, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan, and Sri Lanka—to collaborate on key issues such as digital inclusivity, sustainable network infrastructure, and consumer protection.
items.raw_content: Digital transformation can help Pakistan unlock up to Rs9.7 trillion ($59.7 billion) in annual economic value by 2030, equivalent to about 19% of GDP. Cambodia, Bangladesh, Mongolia, Pakistan, and Uzbekistan classified as 'Low-Digitalization' economies that must accelerate digital transformation.

items.title: Emerging Markets to Grow Nearly 3X Faster Than Advanced Economies in 2026
items.summary: Emerging markets expected to grow nearly three times faster than advanced economies in 2026. India, ASEAN members, and reform-focused Latin American economies show strong potential. Sub-Saharan Africa expected to grow by 3.7% in 2025 and reach 4.3% in 2027. Middle East regional GDP projected to grow by 2.8% in 2025 and 3.3% in 2026. Gulf Cooperation Council expected to grow by 4.1% in 2025 and accelerate to 4.6% in 2026.
items.raw_content: UAE's economy projected to grow by 4.9% in 2025, up from previous estimate of 4.4%, with higher oil output and steady growth in non-hydrocarbon industries. Overall outlook indicates while emerging markets face global challenges including trade tensions and policy uncertainty, regions like India, parts of Africa, and Gulf states show promising growth trajectories.

items.title: Nearly 9 Million Indian Expats in GCC Countries Driving Remittances
items.summary: Nearly 9 million Indian expats live and work in Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) countries, representing over 66 percent of non-resident Indians. Nearly 90 percent of Indian labor migrants head to Middle East, contributing to 40 percent of India's foreign remittances. Simultaneous trend in recent years – drop in blue-collar migration to Middle East countered by increase in skilled white collar. Indian workers' strong English skills, professional work ethic, and educational background make them ideal candidates.
items.raw_content: What may change in labor migration dynamic is distribution of Indian expats across GCC countries and level of their skills, with more opportunities for professionals emerging especially in Saudi Arabia. Pravasi Kaushal Vikas Yojana (PKVY) and Pre-Departure Orientation Training (PDOT) programs preparing low-skilled workers.

items.title: Kenya and Rwanda Fintech Passporting Agreement Enables Cross-Border Operations
items.summary: On February 25, 2025, Bank of Ghana and National Bank of Rwanda signed Africa's first fintech licence-passporting agreement: pact allowing startups licensed in either country to operate in both markets without starting from scratch. This landmark development raises hopes for deeper cross-border collaboration across continent. Looking ahead to 2026, modular approach of going country by country is becoming too slow, and cross-border collaboration and passporting will be critical.
items.raw_content: Central Bank of Kenya responsible for regulating banking sector, including fintech companies providing banking services. Rwanda Fintech Strategy 2024-2029 aims to transform Rwanda into hub for financial services in Africa. Rwanda's central bank launched regulatory sandbox in 2022.

items.title: Startup Funding Week 1 2026: DSShield Secures $54M in Africa & Middle East
items.summary: New year 2026 opened with strong momentum as investors doubled down on cybersecurity, retail infrastructure, fintech inclusion, blockchain systems, and agritech innovation, with DSShield securing massive $54 million investment from Merak Capital. Week 1 2026 showed renewed investor confidence in Africa and Middle East startup ecosystem.
items.raw_content: Investment focus in 2026 on foundational infrastructure: payments, mobility, energy, AI infrastructure, B2B SaaS, and commerce enablers. Fintech still dominant, capturing between 45-60% of total equity investments.

items.title: India's Youth Population: 600 Million Under 25 Years Driving Demographic Dividend
items.summary: India's total population approximately 1.46 billion, with large youth population comprising 42.4% under 25 years and substantial working-age population of 68.4%. More than 600 million Indians currently under age of 25 years and more than 65 percent below age of 35 years. Median age is 29.8 years. National Youth Policy 2021 focuses on holistic development and sustainability, aligned with UN SDGs. Without jobs, voice, and dignity for youth, demographic dividend becomes demographic burden.
items.raw_content: India's urban population expected to grow from 377 million in 2011 to nearly 600 million by 2036. By 2036, India will add more than 600 million new urban dwellers. By 2050, India's population will begin to age.
